title: Understanding DPD
text: Dependent personality disorder (DPD) is a condition where individuals have a strong need to be taken care of by others. This need often leads to submissive and clinging behavior.

title: Characteristics of DPD
text: People with DPD often feel helpless, submissive, or incapable of taking care of themselves. They may rely heavily on others for decision-making and support.

hintAnswer: a pervasive and excessive need to be taken care of by others
title: Identifying the Correct Answer
text: Which of the following best describes dependent personality disorder?
choices: an inflated sense of $$self-importance$$, a constant need for admiration and attention, and a lack of empathy for others
a pervasive pattern of social inhibition, feelings of inadequacy, and hypersensitivity to criticism or rejection
a pervasive and excessive need to be taken care of by others
a pervasive pattern of preoccupation with orderliness, perfectionism, and control
